title: This photograph will scare the pants off you
text:
Toby Segar is not for the faint hearted. Source: Instagram 
IF YOU’RE afraid of heights, look away now. 
Just seeing a picture of Toby Segar’s latest stunt is enough to make the hair on the back of your neck stand up. 
The self-described parkour (free running) lover from the UK visited the famous tourist spot Trolltunga, or Troll’s Tongue, in Norway and decided to engage in some thrillseeking. 
Tourists flock to the picturesque site which has previously been dubbed as “the scariest Instagram spot on earth” but Mr Segar wasn’t content with getting a regular photo. 
Instead, he had his friends snap a picture as he did a backflip on the cliff’s edge — 700m above the pristine Norwegian gorge. Don’t slip: Toby Segar completing the backflip 700m above a gorge at Trolltunga. Source: Instagram 
The 21-year-old played down the danger of his antics but the photo has amazed people online. 
“Everyone is scared of heights, it just takes time to learn how to deal with that fear rationally,” he told the Daily Mail . 
The peak that juts out is about 2m wide, but the rocky and uneven surface meant landing the manoeuvre was not without its challenges. 
“The scary bit was standing on the very edge of the overhang in preparation for the backflip,” he said. 
The popular hiking destination has no protective barriers despite the inherent danger. 
While countless photos have been taken of people peering over the edge, no deaths have been recorded. 
As for Mr Segar, it was all in a day’s work. 
His Instagram account is full of other death-defying antics of himself and his friends. Hanging off a sky scrapper in Bangkok. Pic: TobyCigar Source: Facebook Pic: TobyCigar Source: Instagram 
“I’ve been training parkour for maybe 10 years now which is what really fuels all my travels and motivation to experience as much as possible while I’m still young,” he said. 
And he’s certainly not the only one to combine a thirst for travel and adrenaline inducing stunts. 
A trend among daredevil youths has seen a growing number of videos posted online of teens and young adults scaling buildings, cranes and bridges in an effort to get the perfect shot. Russian-Ukrainian thrill seeker Vitaly Raskalov and his friend Vadim Makhorov took a selfie balanced on a crane atop of the world’s second tallest building. Source: Instagram A Ukrainian Skywalker who hangs off cranes, pylons and high-rise buildings has been dubbed the real life Spider Man. Source: Picture Media
